channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, 18 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day

May 17 is World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Day and the Children’s Tumour Foundation of Australia is joining cities all over the world in lighting up buildings and important landmarks blue and green to help raise awareness of NF. The Children's Tumour Foundation is the patient advocacy and support service for children, adults and families impacted by the genetic condition, neurofibromatosis in Australia

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Tumour Foundation of Australia

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World IBD Day
item.description:
Monday, 19 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support World IBD Day

For more than three decades, Crohn’s & Colitis Australia has been empowering the more than 100,000 Australian's living with Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis collectively known as inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) to live fearlessly. CCA's primary purpose is to provide support services, advice, and encouragement to people with IBD. While we invest in research for a cure, CCA continues to advocate for world best treatments and health services for those living with IBD.

This Light Up is organised by: Crohn's & Colitis Australia

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month
item.description:
Tuesday, 20 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month

Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month is an annual initiative held each May to continue to raise awareness of domestic and family violence and coercive control. The initiative aims to build community awareness of domestic and family violence and mobilise corporate and community action to end domestic and family violence in Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: WOW Day (Wear Orange Wednesday)
item.description:
Wednesday, 21 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to celebrate WOW Day (Wear Orange Wednesday)

Wear Orange Wednesday, or WOW Day is the national day to celebrate and thank SES volunteers. It takes place annually on the Wednesday of National Volunteer Week, this year taking place on Wednesday 21 May 2025. In honour of this day, we take the time to thank our Queensland SES volunteers for their dedication and tireless devotion to their communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland State Emergency Service

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Sustainable BNE Festival
item.description:
Thursday, 22 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to celebrate Sustainable BNE Festival

Brisbane City Council, in partnership with the Brisbane Sustainability Agency, is proud to announce the launch of the Sustainable BNE Festival, an exciting evolution of the much-loved Green Heart Fair.

This transformation reflects Brisbane’s growing ambition to lead the way in sustainability by inspiring residents to embrace eco-friendly practices, shaping a cleaner and more sustainable future as the city prepares for the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. The Sustainable BNE Festival will take place on Sunday 25 May 2025 at Roma Street Parkland, with a goal to be Brisbane’s most dynamic sustainability event yet.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Sustainability Agency



Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Volunteer Week
item.description:
Friday, 23 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate National Volunteer Week

National Volunteer Week is Australia’s largest annual celebration of volunteers and their important contribution to our communities. This special event provides an opportunity to highlight the important role of volunteers in our community and invites people not currently volunteering to give it a go

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:
Saturday, 24 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to celebrate Light Up the Night Gala

Taking place in City Hall, the Light Up the Night Gala is Australia’s premier and purposeful LGBTQ+ fundraising event, hosted by the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation.

item.title: Red Shield Appeal
item.description:
Saturday, 24 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to support Red Shield Appeal

The annual Red Shield Appeal raises awareness of The Salvation Army, and financially supports various vital programs that the Salvation Army has been providing communities in Australia, without discrimination, since 1880. We provide active, practical support designed to meet the social, emotional, material, and spiritual needs of those experiencing hardship through poverty, health issues, dependency issues, unemployment and/or experiencing personal crisis

This Light Up is organised by: Salvation Army

item.title: Cystic Fibrosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, 25 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Cystic Fibrosis Awareness Month

Since 1960 Cystic Fibrosis Queensland has been the peak not for profit charity providing support, services and hope to people living with cystic fibrosis. Cystic Fibrosis Queensland funds research, advocates on the behalf of and delivers welfare, support, and service programs to people living with cystic fibrosis who attend Qld Health for treatment and support. Our mission is Lives unaffected by Cystic Fibrosis and we assist everyone affected by cystic fibrosis to live fuller, healthier lives.
The month of May is our National Awareness month, with activities taking place across the country to raise funds and awareness for people living with cystic fibrosis

This Light Up is organised by: Cystic Fibrosis Queensland

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Sorry Day
item.description:
Monday, 26 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit All colours to support National Sorry Day

National Sorry Day - On 26 May 1997 the landmark ‘Bringing them Home’ report was tabled in federal parliament. ‘Bringing them Home’ is the final report of the ‘National Inquiry into the Separation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Children from Their Families’ and was conducted by the Human Rights and Equal Opportunity Commission (now called the Australian Human Rights Commission) between 1995 and 1997. On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

On 26 May 1998, the first National Sorry Day was held to commemorate the anniversary of the report and remember the grief, suffering and injustice experienced by the stolen generations
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: Eve of LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 27 May 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Rainbow to support the Eve of LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day

The creation of the LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day in 2020 was the first time in history that an awareness day was formed to highlight domestic, family and intimate partner violence and abuse occurring in LGBTQ+ communities. Held annually on May 28, LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Day is the only day like it in the world.
What started in Australia, is now a global event with hundreds of government departments and organisations from 17 countries recognising the day

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: State of Origin - Game I Brisbane
item.description:
Wednesday, 28 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Maroon to celebrate State of Origin - Game I Brisbane

Mark your diaries, Queenslanders! The Queensland Maroons are looking for redemption in 2025! State of Origin is Australia’s greatest sporting rivalry with the 2025 series starting at the home of the Maroons - Brisbane’s Suncorp Stadium, host to Game One on Wednesday, May 28.

This Light Up is organised by: Business Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Darkness to Daylight
item.description:
Thursday, 29 May 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Darkness to Daylight

The Darkness to Daylight event is Challenge DV's flagship fundraising and awareness event which consists of a 110km overnight run, 110km monthly running challenge, and a 10km and 3km community mass-participation event. It is a month-long campaign to raise much needed funds to support Domestic Violence prevention programs. www.darknesstodaylight.org

This Light Up is organised by: Challenge DV

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World MS Day
item.description:
Friday, 30 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support World MS Day

World MS Day is an international awareness day for everyone affected by multiple sclerosis (MS). It brings the global MS community together to share stories, raise awareness and campaign for change. World MS Day is officially marked on the 30 May and is such an important day for people living with MS as they see they are not alone and are supported by the wider community.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Brisbane Marathon Festival
item.description:
Saturday, 31 May 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate the Brisbane Marathon Festival

Celebrating our 33rd year in 2025, the Brisbane Marathon Festival is one of the oldest and most friendly events on the Australian running calendar attracting thousands of participants from over 35 countries annually. The marathon festival includes a half marathon, a 10 km run, a 5 km run/walk and a children's 2 km 'mini marathon'. The event celebrates fun fitness and the test of ultimate human endurance – the Marathon

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Dancing CEO's
item.description:
Saturday, 31 May 2025

City Hall will be lit Purple to celebrate Dancing CEO's

Dancing CEOs is one of Brisbane's greatest gala events for a cause. CEOs & leaders bravely swap the boardroom for the dance floor in front of Corporate Queensland. The event is in celebrate of domestic violence prevention and raises vital funds for the legal & social services provided by WLSQ

This Light Up is organised by: Womens' Legal Services Queensland

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: National Reconciliation Week
item.description:
Sunday, 1 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit All Colours to support National Reconciliation Week.

27 May to 3 June 2025  is National Reconciliation Week - the theme for National Reconciliation Week 2025, “Bridging Now to Next” urges us to look ahead and continue the push forward as past lessons guide us.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

item.title: Mabo Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 3 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Black Yellow Red and Blue White Green to recognise Mabo Day

On 3 June 1992, the High Court of Australia handed down a landmark decision in the Mabo case, overturning the legal concept of terra nullius ~ land belonging to no-one. In acknowledging the traditional rights of the Meriam people to their land, the court also held that native title existed for all Indigenous people, paving the way for new federal legislation the following year, the Native Title Act 1993.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Haemochromatosis Week
item.description:
Wednesday, 4 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support Haemochromatosis Week

Haemochromatosis Australia's vision is that no Australian will suffer harm from haemochromatosis. We provide support for people, their families and loved ones with the disorder, raising awareness of haemochromatosis in the general public and the medical and health professions in order to increase early diagnosis and treatment. We have been operating for over 30 years and continue to grow and expand our activities.
In the first week of June each year we join with members of Haemochromatosis International, the international alliance of haemochromatosis support groups, to create a worldwide, coordinated haemochromatosis awareness campaign in each member country. Using all forms of media, displays, and other activities, this week is an opportunity to focus attention on haemochromatosis and the risk of inherited iron overload.

This Light Up is organised by: Haemochromatosis Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Light Up for Hidradenitis Suppurativa Awareness
item.description:
Thursday, 5 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Purple to support Light Up for Hidradenitis Suppurativa Awareness

Organised by Hidradenitis Suppurativa Australia, The Light Up for HS campaign shines a spotlight on Hidradenitis Suppurativa (HS), a debilitating condition often misunderstood and underdiagnosed. By illuminating landmarks across Australia, we aim to raise awareness, foster understanding, and highlight the battles faced by those living with HS, including late diagnosis and the complexities of treatment. This visual reminder sparks crucial conversations, ensuring that HS stories are heard and that the journey of every HS warrior is recognised and supported. Together, we can bring HS out of the shadows.

This Light Up is organised by: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Queensland Day
item.description:
Friday, 6 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Maroon to celebrate Queensland Day

It's our 166th Birthday! Queensland Day is a celebration of who we are and where we've come from - a day to honour everything that makes our state great. To celebrate all the best of Queensland for our state's birthday, icons and landmarks across Queensland will light up in our state's colour - maroon - to shine with pride on Queensland Day. This Queensland Day, we are calling on all Queenslanders to come together to celebrate all the best that Queensland has to offer. Whether it be our people, arts, culture, sport, lifestyle, iconic landscapes, homegrown produce or our rich history.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of the Premier and Cabinet

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month
item.description:
Sunday, 8 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Teal to support International Myasthenia Gravis Awareness Month

June is Myasthenia Gravis awareness Month. The Myasthenia Gravis Association of Qld Inc., (MGAQ) was formed in 1991 and has been recognised by Queensland Health as the peak body for people with Myasthenia Gravis in Queensland. MGAQ uses this opportunity to raise awareness in the community of this little-known rare disease and support the local Myasthenia group.

This Light Up is organised by: Myasthenia Gravis Association of Queensland Inc (MGAQ)

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Big Freeze 10
item.description:
Monday, 9 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support Big Freeze 10

Founded in 2014, FightMND was established with the purpose of finding effective treatments and ultimately a cure for Motor Neurone Disease
The Big Freeze 10 aims to shine a light on the battle being fought by thousands of people across Australia who are diagnosed with MND, as currently there are no viable treatments and no cure for MND. Part of the Big Freeze 10 , the Mini Freeze will be during the Brisbane Lions vs St Kilda game on Friday 14th of June. Lighting up monuments around the country in our Big Freeze Blue aims to fund essential research and eventually make MND a thing of the past, but also, its an incredible display of solidarity and support for those in the MND community who have died, been diagnosed, or are currently fighting their battle against the Beast.

This Light Up is organised by: Fight MND

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Go Green for EcoMarines
item.description:
Tuesday, 10 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Green to support Go Green for EcoMarines

Go Green for EcoMarines is a statewide, two week-long campaign to raise awareness and funds to support an education-based action program targeting a reduction in waste and pollution and promoting recycling and other sustainable living options.
EcoMarines Foundation is a leading not for profit organisation providing education to school students on the impacts of everyday activities on their local landscapes, water systems and downstream marine environments. EcoMarines also provides support to help them target pollution and other negative human impacts in their local area, protecting those environments and promoting a sustainable lifestyle.

This Light Up is organised by: Tangalooma EcoMarines Foundation

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Thank a First Responder Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 11 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Thank a First Responder Day

Thank a First Responder Day, a Fortem Australia initiative, is a National Day of Appreciation for first responders and their families. Held annually on the second Wednesday in June, on this day we call on the community to show their appreciation to local first responders by simply saying 'thank you'. In 2025, Thank a First Responder Day will fall on Wednesday, 11 June and we will host events in recognition of first responders across the week.

This Light Up is organised by: Fortem Australia Ltd

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 127th Philippines Independence Day
item.description:
Thursday, 12 June 2025

City Hall will be lit Red White and Blue to celebrate the 127th Philippines Independence Day

The Philippine Declaration of Independence was proclaimed on June 12th 1898. Today the Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Incorporated would like to reach out Brisbane and its Filipino-Australians, and all residents to join together to celebrate the Philippines 127th Independence Day

This Light Up is organised by: Chamber of Commerce and Industry Australia Philippines Inc

item.title: MS Brissie to the Bay
item.description:
Saturday, 14 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support MS Brissie to the Bay

JOIN THE ICONIC MS BRISSIE TO THE BAY!
Our ever-popular MS Brissie to the Bay ride is back on Sunday 15 June for its 35th year and we’d love you to be part of this life-changing movement!
Choose from four great courses, designed to give riders of all ages and fitness levels the chance to be part of this fantastic community event. There’s also a ‘Ride For All’ which takes place on static bikes at the Event Village.

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

item.title: World Elder Abuse Awareness Day
item.description:
Sunday, 15 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support World Elder Abuse Awareness Day

World Elder Abuse Awareness Day was launched on June 15, 2006 by the International Network for the Prevention of Elder Abuse and the World Health Organization at the United Nations. WEAAD also supports the United Nations International Plan of Action that acknowledges the significance of elder abuse a as a public health and human rights issue.
World Elder Abuse Awareness Day provides an opportunity for communities around the world to promote a better understanding of abuse and neglect of older persons by raising awareness of the cultural, social, economic and demographic processes affecting elder abuse and neglect.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Child Safety, Seniors and Disability Services and UnitingCare

Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: NCWQ Celebrating 120 Years
item.description:
Monday, 16 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to celebrate 120 Years of NCWQ 

The National Council of Women of Queensland (NCWQ) is an umbrella organisation for thirty women’s organisations. We seek to raise awareness of the rights and responsibilities of members as citizens and encourages their participation in all aspects of community life.
The 120th Anniversary celebration is to acknowledge significant difference NCWQ has made with a theme of Celebrating Queensland Women’s Voices; the legacy, leadership and change. NCWQ was started on 15th June 1905.

This Light Up is organised by: The National Council of Women of QLD (NCWQ)

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: National Police Legacy Day
item.description:
Tuesday, 17 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support National Police Legacy Day

This year, on 17 June, we proudly mark a new tradition: the very first National Police Legacy Day.
For 54 years, Police Legacy organisations across Australia have provided support to police and their families. Through both heartbreak and healing. Now, we come together nationally to honour this legacy of care. It is also a day to recognise all those who serve in our police forces — and the families who uphold their memory with strength and pride.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Police Legacy Scheme

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

This year, on 17 June, we proudly mark a new tradition: the very first National Police Legacy Day.
For 54 years, Police Legacy organisations across Australia have provided support to police and their families. Through both heartbreak and healing. Now, we come together nationally to honour this legacy of care. It is also a day to recognise all those who serve in our police forces — and the families who uphold their memory with strength and pride.

This Light Up is organised by: The Queensland Police Legacy Scheme

item.title: State of Origin - Game II Perth
item.description:
Wednesday, 18 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Maroon to support State of Origin - Game II Perth

Perth’s Optus Stadium will host the much-anticipated State of Origin Game II between the New South Wales 'Blues' and Queensland 'Maroons' on Wednesday, 18 June 2025.
State of Origin is one of Australian sport’s greatest rivalries where Queensland is looking for redemption in this years series.

item.title: World Sickle Cell Day
item.description:
Thursday, 19 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support World Sickle Cell Day

World Sickle Cell Day, which takes place on June 19 each year, is an internationally recognised awareness day promoting equitable access to treatment of those living with sickle cell anaemia and to break down stigma in the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell Australia

item.title: YRNA Fun Run
item.description:
Friday, 20 June 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support YRNA Fun Run

You Are Not Alone is a youth mental health charity dedicated to shining a light on youth mental health, through engagement with schools and community events. The annual YRNA Fun Run aims to shine a light on youth mental health and raise funds for awareness events in our local community. Our main goal is to empower young people to speak up and remind them they are not alone.

This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone Australia Limited

item.title: MND Global Awareness Day
item.description:
Saturday, 21 June 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue to support MND Global Awareness Day

Each year on 21 June the MND Queensland joins with the wider MND community around the world to mark Global MND Awareness Day – a day to honour everyone affected by motor neurone disease. This year, we’re shining a light on the hidden realities of living with MND

This Light Up is organised by: MND Queensland

item.title: Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
item.description:
Wednesday, 25 June 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Migraine Awareness Month - ‘Give Migraine a Break’
 

Migraine Australia is celebrating Migraine Awareness Month again this June with our ‘Give Migraine a Break’ campaign.
We start the month with ‘Burple Day’ on Friday June 6 where we ask everyone to dress in burgundy or purple for awareness of migraine.
Shades for Migraine is on Saturday June 21, an international day for migraine, we ask everyone to wear sunglasses, take a selfie and post it to socials, in support of people with migraine.

Migraine Australia is the only national patient advocacy organisation to support all Australians, through advocacy, information and support, led by people living with Migraine. We work to actively and demonstrably improve the quality of life and wellbeing of all Australians living with Migraine and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Migraine Australia



Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
